Reviews.Title: Warranty pain
Reviews.Author: Billupnorth
Reviews.Content: I purchashed a pack of 3 FI8905W cameras, and 1 failed after 2 months.  Foscam sent me to Amazon for repair/replacement, then Amazon told me that my 30 return window had closed.Beware, Foscam cameras do not have a warranty if not purchashed from Foscam directly on their site.  Even if you buy a Foscam camera from Foscam, **via Amazon's site** - no warrenty.  If you really need one of these cameras, pay a little extra and buy from Foscam's site.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install , Great Daytime color
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: These cameras are great.  Daytime images are clear and colors are accurate.Night time images with IR, are black and white and are clear.Works well either hard wired or wireless on the network.I use IP Cam Viewer on my iPhone and Foscam's Software on my iPad.  Both work very well with these camera.I have Blue Iris installed on a server at home to monitor and record any motion.  5 stars for Blue Iris too.Installation and setup could not be easier.Plug camera into network using supplied cables and power up.Run the software on the included CD.  This finds the camera on the network.Log into the web interface and make the changes that you want.I would recommend setting it up with a static IP address.Camera will reboot a few times depending on the changes made.Mount Camera and you are ready to go.Cons:1- Lens is a bit long.  Could use a slightly wider angle lens in most situations.2- When mounted some what remotely, the issue is trying to get the power to the camera.  I have been trying an external POE cable set, but it requires a lot of waterproofing of the connectors and after a certain length will no longer power the camera.3- The supplied mount is weak for such a heavy camera.  Wind will move the camera around.  I've used shelf brackets from Home Depot and bend them so the camera is pointed where I need it.One other method I used, is to get a hook with a wood screw end at Home Depot.  Cut off the hook part. Then with a die, cut the appropriate thread for the camera mount.  I put two nuts on it and screwed it into the soffit on the house. Then screwed the camera onto the stud and tightened the nuts against the camera.  You need enough room under the soffit for the camera to fully turn. Extremely stable.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: wack
Reviews.Content: I would not purchas this model camera again (F18905W). The other Foscams I have purchased have been great, but these are zoomed in to close and they wash out in sunlight. The fix for the Zoomed in problem is to order new lenses.

Reviews.Title: I got Stuck, and called Foscam Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Bernie "Bernie S"
Reviews.Content: I called in for help and my Agent was Tim Moraes, he is very knowledgeable and helpful. I knew I did something wrong configuring the three cameras and he bailed me out and was very patient as I was plugging the cameras back in, and he verified the firmware. and configuration of each camera. walked through and resolved each issue I had.The FOSCAM Support Team are Professionals and courteous.Great Job Tim.Thank you,

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Carioca
Reviews.Content: I am using three Foscam FI8905W Outdoor Wireless/Wired IP Camera, in Rio de Janeiro, Brasil.  I like this camera; the easy of use web interface, configuration options, plus great image are excellent. I am very satisfied with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Review
Reviews.Author: ralay
Reviews.Content: I like it  has remote capabilities and can be linked to my Email and cell phone.If not a computer wiz may have a little trouble connecting up, but Foscam has excellent Tec support.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Brenda Fletcher
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service.  I highly recommend customer service assitance.  Love the remote acess via IP address.  Excellent product for the costs.I highly recommed these cameras for home use.

Reviews.Title: Great Service!!
Reviews.Author: Ace Locates "icor611"
Reviews.Content: Had Peter help me on line and he was patient and smart too! Recommend this product. I purchased 6 total camera (three indoor and three outdoor) they came before the delivery date and when I went to set them all up I got stuck. Called their tech support and they were busy so called me back. The same day! I talked with Peter and he took control of my computer and just did it all for me. Nice.

Reviews.Title: Looks Great...Sounds Great...
Reviews.Author: Nick79
Reviews.Content: I own an indoor Foscam FI8910W and love it; I have it watching the front door & living room, no complaints about it other then the audio plugin still doesnt work.  Set-up was easy, as was the marketing on this set-up.  Far from it, for me.  I am tech-savy, my girlfriend works in IT...we get the stuff.  Set-up IS easy, if it works.  Wireless set-up never worked, on three camera's.  Once it was assigned to the router and unplugged, nothing - no go.  Tried it again, nothing...multiple times, different people.  There was no live support to try and reach.  None responsive email to "support," as well.I took a break and to blow off steam, I tried to figure out how to mount the camera's; note they are much bigger then you'd expect - really consider the dimensions.  My girlfriend even sarcastically commented, "those look industrial."  They are rather large and somewhat embarrassing to put up on a home.  Who needs such a big camera?  You can find smaller ones that are just as good; and I have.  They wouldn't fit in the areas I wanted them (areas that don't make them so visible; under eaves, etc.).  The mount that comes with it is cheap and should not be used - you have a potentiel for breaking - however, you CAN buy a better one (go figure).Consider location when setting this up, not just for wireless purposes, but for power supply.  You dont want the cords to be visible (for cosmetic purposes alone) to an intruder who could easily cut the power supply line.  I planned on running the cords via the attic into the nearest outlet; what seems like an easy set-up takes a lot of time.Again, if you want the cords visible, you wont have to drill into the walls and go into the attic, this is just my preference.  I just think for exposure alone, you should.All in all, the picture quality (once plugged into the router and up on the screen) is nice, but not worth all the work.I could not combine these three cameras with the two indoor cameras on the software included; it would require two separate viewing pages; not ideal on a mobile app.In the end, I've given up based on the size of the camera & cheap mounting bracket (I'm not buying more equipment).  I went with the name because of a previous product, but this one isn't for me.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Review
Reviews.Author: Graeme
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Product and unbelievably good back up from the technical support team - very highly recommend.  I had a problem setting up the camera initially, one call to support and not only did they resolve the issue but they went above and beyond by setting up a number of other features on my behalf - I can't speak highly enough of them!

Reviews.Title: great night vision
Reviews.Author: tomcat3
Reviews.Content: i would purchase these again, the mounting brackets would not hold up the cameras, i found some others that were heavier duty on Amazon, cameras are heavy and need heavy duty brackets, software was complex but managable, night vision is great, i am getting over 50' in night vision and as much as 100' wireless unubstructed range i needed support with 1 camera, had trouble getting it to go wireless, after a few minutes on the phone and internet with Foscam tech team it was all up and running great. also purchased Foscam Blue Iris that makes the software go much smoother.

Reviews.Title: IP Cam
Reviews.Author: Yogi Bear
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time as promised. The set up was fairly easy and the picture is OUTSTANDING! I would recomend this product to anyone who needs a weather resistant camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellant Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Kim W Miller
Reviews.Content: Calvin from tech support from Foscam was more than helpful. He was very well versed in this field. I could have not set these cameras up with out his Help! He was Great!

Reviews.Title: Okay, if you want low quality.
Reviews.Author: Brian Gray
Reviews.Content: Poorly designed connections are easy for water intrusion.  They have a "dongle" type ethernet jack and power input as well as a reset button.  Unless these connections are protected from the weather, they will be damaged.  Awful design.Wireless range is okay.Video image is okay, if the scene is relatively evenly lit, as in a shaded yard, or on a cloudy day.  If it is sunny with shadows, the sunny areas go almost white, the shadow areas go too dark.  At night, with the night vision, you couldn't possibly identify a license plate on a car, or a person because they get blown out white when they get within 15 feet of the camera.  Further away and the resolution is so poor that you just can't identify anything.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM FI8905W Outdoor Wireless / Wired Câmera IP - 3 Pack
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Pereira Garcia
Reviews.Content: In one of the boxes was not found all the pieces, missing a cable network.As performed validation tests, the cameras usually work. Viewed as one of the cameras has minor scratches in the paint of the body of the camera.

Reviews.Title: 2/3 stopped working on 1st day
Reviews.Author: kchercmech "Bo"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by stating why I chose these cameras. For 3 years I have been looking at IP camera solutions that would fit into my budget and networking understanding. I went to a cookout at a friends house and he wanted to show me the new cameras he put up - Foscam FI8905w's. He had had them installed for several weeks and reported zero issues so I bought them thinking they were the answer I had been searching for.I spent two days running all of the conduit and wire on the outside of the house to power these cameras. I only fell off the roof once - very steep roof. The following day after the complete install I was told that one of them was not working by my Lady so I investigated - turned out that one of the GFCI's tripped - maybe from a power spike or something not related to the camera at all - I'll give them the benefit of doubt. I reset it and it did not trip again. For the next three days Camera 2 would come on, then go out, then come on, then go out. On the third day Camera 1 began the same issue and Camera 2 would only broadcast the video in purple and green.I called Foscam, they told me it sounds like a hardware issue but they wanted me to go through the reset procedure to see if it would clear up. It did not. For the few hours a day when I could see the images from Camera 2 it only showed the world in a purple/green image. Camera 1 went out completely and never did turn back on.Not happy Bob, not happy.Further issues I noticed:These cameras are for close ups only! I believe they are meant to record faces and not areas. I had Camera 1 installed on the roof line of the second story and could only see part of my car because they were zoomed in so very far. Camera 2 was installed on the third floor roof line and I could only see half of my tiny 36x10' deck which sits at the second floor level. This would be a great feature if I used these cameras (if they worked) as face recognition cameras. Furthermore, the IR emitters are very bright! On the first night they were installed I placed electrical tape over all but ONE of the few dozen emitters and it was almost too bright. When a person walked in from of the camera their face was completely whited out by the IR emitters. I fail to see what the importance of having that much IR light is in a camera that is seemingly designed for face recognition (close up viewing). The viewing angle is similar to looking through a 4x scope while viewing a target 25' away - you can see ever detail of the person as long as the person is being viewed in the daylight - at night all of their detail is washed completely out by the emitters. I returned the cameras and again am searching for a good camera that actually works.

Reviews.Title: Keeps losing signal
Reviews.Author: suzy
Reviews.Content: Like the cameras, we already have the pan and tilt indoor cameras which work great.  the outdoor cameras keep losing the wifi signal.  once hooked back into the router, no problems, but when disconnected to be wireless, they keep losing signal.  just a real pain.  they are made very well and the picture day or night is teriffic, only complaint, keeps losing wireless signal.

Reviews.Title: Worked 1 year and then stopped working.
Reviews.Author: Grumpy
Reviews.Content: If you can, avoid this particular product. I purchased three of them and they worked exactly 1 year and on their anniversary stopped working. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Jill R. Bodenhamer
Reviews.Content: These cameras won't even stay connected to a wireless router, you have to take them down and reconfigure them daily!! The picture that they give you for a few seconds is great but like I said it only lasts for a few seconds literally. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: Wireless Camera Junk
Reviews.Author: JWS
Reviews.Content: Rigged the three cams up at home and let them burn in before mounting. Within 24 hours two units failed. Do not be foolish unless you want to burn money,

Reviews.Title: High-quality, easy to use, email pictures are good, but no HTTPS
Reviews.Author: C. Nowell
Reviews.Content: These cameras could do everything that I wanted.  The built-in dynameic DNS server makes setup a snap. They even email a few pictures when they detect motion, so you can see more of what's happening.  However, they make you log in without SSL, so if you are logging in with your cell phone over a public wireless network, your password can be intercepted.

Reviews.Title: Good cam
Reviews.Author: NK
Reviews.Content: Works as described. The wireless range can be spotty if the antenna is not on the camera. So make sure you connect the antenna.

Reviews.Title: narrow field of view
Reviews.Author: Maurice Kelly
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend these cameras because they have a very narrow field of view.  I called support for assistance and foscam support was no help at all.  I install a lot of cameras so going forward I will not be using foscam products.  I would recommend anyone looking for exterior security cameras to stay away from this product.

Reviews.Title: Narrow viewing angle and inconsistent quality
Reviews.Author: Badadesi "badadesi"
Reviews.Content: One out of the three cameras does not work at night -- I am guessing IR issues.  The other two are working as expected.Pros1. Good colors during the day and decent b&w; vision at night.2. Sturdy build of the cameraCons1. Lack of consistent quality -- one camera does not work at night [indoor cameras I brought have issues as well];2. The viewing angle on the camera is too narrow;3. The anchors to install the camera are flimsy and difficult to use in a tight spot;4. Software could be better -- difficult to get it to work with IE and asks for user-id and password twice.I am going to try and reach tech support to determine issues on the one camera that does not work at night.  It will give me a chance to assess their tech support and commitment to product quality.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8905W
Reviews.Author: Audry Clark
Reviews.Content: Easy setup for anyone with minimal technical abilities, just follow the instructions on the CD. The night vision feature is excellent and the wireless feature is phenomenal. They are well built and sturdy. You can mount them from the top or the bottom. The picture is clear. They don't have a zoom option though. You can snap pictures or record short videos which can include pre-motion frames which I think is fantastic. I bought three for my house and will be buying three more. I wish the view angle was a little wider on them. Price wise I'm still better off buying three more cameras than buying a wider viewing angle camera. The manufacturer software is very basic. For a much wider range of alerts and recording options I recommend you use Blue Iris instead. I can see what's going on at my home from anywhere while I'm at the office or traveling (on any computer with internet connection or on my iPhone) Overall excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Work great..
Reviews.Author: Peter Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the bucks.simple set up..I would recommend this unit to anyone. If you can set up your router then port port forwarding isn't that hard...

ProductInfo.Features:
Simple to setup, friendly GUI, remote viewing, record from anywhere anytime
Waterproof for outdoor installation, Auto IR-LED illumination for night vision up to 30 meters
Motion detection alert via email or upload image to FTP. Access management with password protection.
Supports all standard browsers and can be viewed remotely using smartphone software (not included)
Wi-Fi compliant with wireless standards IEEE 802.11b/g and supports both WEP & WPA WPA2 encryption
ProductInfo.Name: Foscam FI8905W Outdoor Wireless/Wired IP Camera - 3 Pack
